intro: Koanophyllon quisqueyanum, commonly known as the Mexican leafy spurge, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and has a low, sprawling growth habit. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish. Koanophyllon quisqueyanum is often found in disturbed areas and can be invasive in certain environments.
